meanings.definition: Neurons that transmit impulses between other neurons.
meanings.sent1: The interneurons help messages move between different neurons.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how interneurons pass signals between nerve cells.
meanings.sent3: The interneurons had a meeting to discuss passing on messages.
meanings.sent4: Like messengers in a busy city, interneurons swiftly deliver information.
meanings.sent5: The interneurons act as bridges, connecting one neuron to another.

meanings.definition: Nerve cells that are found entirely within the central nervous system.
meanings.sent1: Interneurons are located only within the central nervous system.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are researching the functions of interneurons in the brain.
meanings.sent3: The interneurons in the brain threw a party for the spinal cord neurons.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city of the central nervous system, interneurons are the local residents.
meanings.sent5: The interneurons work behind the scenes, ensuring smooth communication within the brain.

meanings.definition: Cells that integrate signals from sensory neurons and relay signals to motor neurons.
meanings.sent1: Interneurons process messages from sensory neurons and send them to motor neurons.
meanings.sent2: The interneurons play a crucial role in coordinating signals within the nervous system.
meanings.sent3: During the relay race, the interneurons passed the baton between sensory and motor neurons.
meanings.sent4: Interneurons act as traffic controllers, directing signals to their destinations.
meanings.sent5: The interneurons are like conductors orchestrating the symphony of nerve signals.
